page.title: 09EDUCATION AROUND HEADCORN
page.content: Within the village there is a{nursery {school and a play school}for children under five. Both attempt to prepare children for entry to the{village {Primary School}where they stay until they are eleven. A small number of children attend{private schools elsewhere and either board or travel daily. Children who live more than 3 miles from the Primary School travel by taxi. At the age of 11 all children travel,usually by School Bus,to{High {Schools}at Lenham,Maidstone or perhaps Tenterden. They leave these schools at 16. At 13 some of the more academic pupils will have transferred to an {Upper School}in Maidstone to prepare for public examinations such as G.C.E. "O" or "A" Level. Many then go to {University}or to{Colleges of Further {Education.}There are also{courses}in Maidstone to train unemployed youths.
